text: The vice chair of the Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System is the second-highest officer of the Federal Reserve, after the chair of the Federal Reserve. The vice chair and the vice chair for supervision each serve a four- year term after being nominated by the president of the United States and confirmed by the United States Senate. The position of vice chair is currently held by Philip Jefferson who was sworn in on September 13, 2023. ==List of vice chairs== Portrait Name Term of office Tenure length Appointed by Start of term End of term 1 August 10, 1914 August 9, 1916 Woodrow Wilson 2 August 10, 1916 August 9, 1918 3 October 26, 1918 March 15, 1920 4 July 23, 1920 September 14, 1930 5 August 21, 1934 February 10, 1936 Franklin D. title: Vice Chair of the Federal Reserve
